alert.note: Alert for Hardin; Hart; Larue (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 29 at 11:51PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM EDT/2 AM CDT/ SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of NORTH CENTRAL and SOUTH CENTRAL Kentucky, including the following counties, in NORTH CENTRAL Kentucky, Hardin and Larue. In SOUTH CENTRAL Kentucky, Hart. * WHEN...Until 300 AM EDT /200 AM CDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1151 PM EDT /1051 PM CDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.8 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Upton, Sonora, Bonnieville, Nolin, Glendale, Flint Hill, Seven Corners, Talley, Vento and Star Mills. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
